Visualization
=======================================================================
Row
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

### confirmed {.value-box}

```{r}
TotalCases <- read.csv("https://opendata.ecdc.europa.eu/covid19/casedistribution/csv", na.strings = "", fileEncoding = "UTF-8-BOM") %>%   dplyr::select(Cases = cases) %>% sum()
valueBox(TotalCases,caption = "Total Confirmed Cases", color = "purple")
```

### active {.value-box}

```{r}
valueBox(32, caption = "Active Cases", color = "warning")
```

### Total Recovered Cases

```{r}
valueBox(32, color = "forestgreen")
```


### death {.value-box}

```{r}
TotalDeaths <- read.csv("https://opendata.ecdc.europa.eu/covid19/casedistribution/csv", na.strings = "", fileEncoding = "UTF-8-BOM") %>%   dplyr::select(Deaths = deaths) %>% sum()
valueBox(TotalDeaths,"Total deaths", color = "red")
```

Data
=======================================================================
### Covid-19 All Country Data
```{r}
#these libraries need to be loaded
library(utils)
library(dplyr)
#read the Dataset sheet into “R”. The dataset will be called "data".

read.csv("https://opendata.ecdc.europa.eu/covid19/casedistribution/csv", na.strings = "", fileEncoding = "UTF-8-BOM") %>%   dplyr::select(Date = dateRep,Year = year ,Cases = cases, Deaths = deaths, Country = countriesAndTerritories ) %>%
   DT::datatable(rownames = TRUE, caption = 'This Data Update Automatically Every day',
            options = list(searchHighlight = TRUE, 
                           pageLength = 20), filter = 'top')
```
